Authors: Chang Lin Zhao, Kari Timo Steffen, Bao-Kai Cui
Title:
Yuchengia, a new polypore genus segregated from Perenniporia
(Polyporales, Basidiomycota) based on morphological and molecular
characters.
Abstract:
A new genus, Yuchengia, is proposed by using a combination
of morphological and molecular data, and Perenniporia narymica is
designed as its generic type. The new genus is shown to represent a
monophyletic lineage sister to a clade comprising the type and some
other species of Perenniporia in the core polyporoid clade based on
sequences of the rDNA ITS and LSU regions. Yuchengia shares some common
characters with Perenniporia, both having thick-walled and cyanophilous
basidiospores, but Yuchengia differs from Perenniporia by having amyloid
and acyanophilous skeletal hyphae and non-dextrinoid basidiospores.
